p: Cetyltrimethylammonium bromide (C 19H 42NBr, molecular weight = 364.45 g/mol), silver nitrate (AgNO 3, molecular weight = 169.87 g/mol), safranin (C 20H 19N 4 +.Cl −, molecular weight = 350.85 g/mol, water soluble) were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich and there stock solutions were prepared in deionized water by molarities basis. All chemicals inorganic electrolytes (NaCl, NaBr, NaI, NaNO 3, Na 2SO 4 and NaOH), organic solvents (methanol, ethanol, chloroform, and diethyl ether) and HCl were of analytical grade. Water (deionized and CO 2 free) was employed as solvent for the preparation of solutions and dilution. Standard HCl and NaOH solutions were used to maintain the pH for the batch kinetic experiments. Silver nitrate solution was kept in dark to minimize the photochemical oxidation. The deionized water was used as solvent throughout the studies.
